The compatibility condition (C)
A subgroup F\le\mathrm{Aut}(B_{d,k}) satifies the compatibility condition (C) if and only if if \mathrm{U}_{k}(F) is locally action isomorphic to F, see . The term compatibility comes from the following translation of this condition into properties of the (k-1)-local actions of elements of F: The group F satisfies (C) if and only if \forall \alpha\in F\ \forall\omega\in\Omega\ \exists\beta\in F:\ \sigma_{k-1}(\alpha,b)=\sigma_{k-1}(\beta,b_{\omega}),\ \sigma_{k-1}(\alpha,b_{\omega})=\sigma_{k-1}(\beta,b).
